title: Why is league of legends popular?

replies.body:
You cannot answer a "why" question with a "yes" or a "no".

i.e. Q: Why is the sky blue?
A: Yes.
Why did that man die, was it because he was old?

The Yes/No answer to that is to the "was" part of the question, not the "why" part. Also, instead of a comma, there should be a "?". Therefore 2 questions are asked, the second being a suggestion answering the first.
was it because he was old? cannot be answered without the "Why did that man die" therefore the question is yes or no solely because of the "Why did that man die"
What is wrong with you people?
What is wrong with you?{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

That makes no sense. The overall questions is a yes or no question cause of the second part, which Is a qualifier. "Why did that man die" by itself can not be answered with a yes or no. Adding a was question doesn't change that fact. Because in reality your not answering the "Why did that man die" part your answering the "was it because he was old"part

And you can answer "Was it because he was old" with a yes or no. Without the first question it may be the wrong answer but it's still a valid answer. Whereas for the why question a yes or no question makes no sense. That's the difference between an open question and a closed question.

The point still stands the question is only made answerable because it has a why in it.

I don't care if it sounds or reads wrong to you, you can go look this up.

Not true. You can totally answer "Was it because he was old" by Itself. You'd use the context of the rest of the discussion. But either way you can answer that question with a yes or no. 

You can't answer "Why did he die" with a yes or no. That's not how questions work. As a whole "Why did that man die, was it because he was old" is answersable with a yes or no. But only because your essentially  providing the answer to your own question. 

"Which way did he go?" "South"
"Which way did he go, was it south" "Yes". 

It only becomes a yes or no question when you provide a potential answer that can be confirmed or denied. That doesn't make the first question a yes or no question. 

A single why question by itself with no qualifying statements or potential answers provided can not be answered with a yes or a no.

Its still a simple fact that the question has an answer of yes and no, without the context given by the why there would be no viable answer. Full stop. End of it, I'm sick of your shit Larry.

I really don't give a damn about what you believe I am simply stating, that is correct to say that is a yes or no question, i don't give a damn what you think, put 5 min of research into it instead of complaining then drop it, its not hard.

You're acting like a spoilt 8 yearold who has to always be right, I don't give a damn about what you think it right or not, I'm just stating what is right, I am not saying I'm agreeing with one side, or the other, I am saying that that is a technically correct question no matter what god damn way you look at it, whatever you say, whatever you do, the point still stands, it is correct. Go ask your damn English teacher if you're so worried about it.

Seriously? Try having a discussion instead of just yelling your position. I'm not acting like a spoilt 8 year old, you are. You state your position without any explanation and then tell me not to state my position can you get any more hypocritical. 

The point has never been about whether or not it's a technically correct question. Of course it is, but that doesn't change the fact you can't answer an open ended question with a yes or no. And why questions are by default open ended question. If you add a second question, it's no longer just a why question.

If he said instead "Why is league of legends popular, is it because of x". It would be fine. That doesn't mean you can answer the why question with a yes or no.

Already told you I'm sick of your shit Larry, so shut up, you can't accept it so be it, leave me alone now, you are ignoring the big picture, only looking at small part, which is all you want to make your basis on, probably why you are still bronze, ignoring the bigger picture and all.

Mate it sounds like your the one having trouble accepting things. Two people have explained it to you now and you still don't get it. You could have just ignored my answers butcha always gotta have the last word. And your still silver cause you think your better than everyone else when your not.

As i said, blind to the bigger picture.

Sick of your shit Larry.
